A: 1. Peaceful Co-existence means different people living together in _ (a) conflict (b) peace (c) silence
2. When there is no disagreement among people, there is peaceful co-existence (a) True (b) False
3. Jesus taught us to _ those who offend us (a) punish (b) forgive (c) ignore
4. God wants us to live peacefully with others in the community (a) True (b) False
5. An example of people desiring peaceful co-existence in the Bible is _ and Jacob (a) Moses (b) Esau (c) David
6. Esau and Jacob reconciled after Jacob took the _ (a) land (b) blessings (c) money
7. Abraham prevented a quarrel between him and his nephew, _ (a) Saul (b) Isaac (c) Lot
8. It is good to show _ to others (a) anger (b) love (c) indifference
9. We should consider those who are around us (a) True (b) False
10. Jesus wants us to show love and _ to people (a) hatred (b) hostility (c) hospitality
11. We should tell others the truth and be _ to them (a) closed-minded (b) open-minded (c) deceitful
12. Jonathan and David showed _ love to each other (a) selfish (b) unselfish (c) conditional
13. Jonathan loved David as his own _ (a) brother (b) soul (c) friend
14. King Saul was Jonathan's _ (a) brother (b) father (c) uncle
15. Jonathan saved David from King Saul's plan to _ him (a) promote (b) kill (c) marry
16. Jonathan hid David in a place far away from Saul's _ (a) house (b) sight (c) family
17. Jonathan and David made a _ (a) treaty (b) covenant (c) promise
18. Pupils should show love to _ (a) only friends (b) only family (c) one another
19. We should show love to those in danger and give help to the _ (a) rich (b) needy (c) strong
20. One way to show love is to share our _ with others (a) secrets (b) belongings (c) worries
B: 1. _________ is when different people live together in peace.
2. Jesus advised us to _________ those who offend us.
3. God wants us to live _________ with others in the community.
5. Jonathan and David made a _________ to show their love.
C: 1. Explain the concept of "Peaceful Co-existence" as described in the text.
2. According to the text, what did Jesus teach about living peacefully with others?
3. Describe how Jonathan demonstrated unselfish love towards David.
4. List two ways pupils and people in society should show love to one another, according to the text.
5. Why is it important to show unselfish love to others, based on the provided text?
answers_C: Peaceful Co-existence means different people living together in peace without any disagreement or fight, fostering harmony.
Jesus taught that if somebody offends us, we should forgive the person and live happily together.
Jonathan showed unselfish love by telling David about King Saul's plan to kill him, hiding him, and making a covenant with him.
Pupils should share their belongings with others and protect one another when there is danger.
It is important to show unselfish love because Jesus wants us to be loving and hospitable, tell the truth, be open-minded, and help those in danger or need.
